pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2: Most of these practices are obscure. They are explained further down in the text.
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.5: See CPD, sub-point 3g, for this use of _kata_.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.13: {Sp-ṭ.1} (p.42): _Siṅgena loṇaṃ pariharitvā pariharitvā aloṇakapiṇḍapātena saddhiṃ bhuñjituṃ kappati, na sannidhiṃ karotīti adhippāyo._ “Carrying salt in horn here and there, is it allowable to eat it together with unsalted almsfood? The meaning is one should not store it.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.34: _Āmāvuso, api ca mayaṃ garunissayaṃ gaṇhāmāti_. {Sp-ṭ.4.454}: _Garunissayaṃ gaṇhāmāti kiñcāpi mayaṃ mahallakā, etaṃ pana theraṃ garuṃ katvā vasissāmāti adhippāyo_, “_Garunissayaṃ gaṇhāma_: although I am a senior monk, I will dwell respecting this senior monk.” | {Vmv.4.454} adds: _Garunissayaṃ gaṇhāmāti nissayamuttāpi mayaṃ ekaṃ sambhāvanīyagaruṃ nissayabhūtaṃ gahetvāva vasissāmāti adhippāyo_, “_Garunissayaṃ gaṇhāma_: even though I no longer need support, I will live supported by one who is to be respected.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4: {Vmv.4.455} explains _mūlādāyakā_ as follows: _Mūlādāyakāti paṭhamaṃ dasavatthūnaṃ dāyakā_, “_Mūlādāyakā_ means those who first gave the ten practices.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.5: _Kullakavihārena_. {Sp.4.455}: _Kullakavihārenāti uttānavihārena_, “_Kullakavihāra_ means a straightforward meditation.” This, however, seems like a put-down, which does not fit the context well. It seems more likely to me that _kullaka_ is instead related to Sanskrit _kulya_, “of a good/noble family.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20: _Idaṃ paṭhamaṃ salākaṃ nikkhipāmi_, “This is the first voting ticket that I place.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.23: _Kappati, bhante, dvaṅgulāya chāyāya vītivattāya vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjitunti_, literally, “When two finger-breadths of shade have passed, is it allowable to eat at the wrong time.” I interpret this to mean within two finger-breadths of midday.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.50: _Uposathasaṃyutta_. Identified at {Sp-ṭ.3.457} as the _Uposathakkhandhaka_, “The Chapter on the Observance Day.” But perhaps it is best regarded as a forerunner to the _Uposathakkhandhaka_.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.109: _Chedanake pācittiyanti_. {Sp.4.457}: _Chedanakasikkhāpade vuttapācittiyaṃ āpajjatīti attho_, “The meaning is he commits the said offense entailing confession in the training rule on cutting.”
